metadata.description: ASD screening questionnaire based on M-CHAT-R and AQ-10 validated tools

sections.name: Early Development and Social Communication
sections.description: Questions about early development and social communication patterns (based on M-CHAT-R)

questions.text: Does your child enjoy being swung, bounced on your knee, etc.?
questions.explanation: Enjoyment of physical play and movement activities

questions.text: Does your child take an interest in other children?
questions.explanation: Social interest and awareness of peers

questions.text: Does your child like climbing on things, such as up stairs?
questions.explanation: Motor development and exploration behaviors

questions.text: Does your child enjoy playing peek-a-boo/hide-and-seek?
questions.explanation: Social play and anticipation of interaction

questions.text: Does your child ever pretend, for example, to talk on the phone or take care of dolls, or pretend other things?
questions.explanation: Symbolic play and imagination development

questions.text: Does your child ever use his/her index finger to point, to ask for something?
questions.explanation: Imperative pointing for requesting

questions.text: Does your child ever bring objects over to you (parent) to show you something?
questions.explanation: Joint attention and sharing interests with others

questions.text: Does your child look you in the eye for more than a second or two?
questions.explanation: Eye contact and social connection

questions.text: Does your child make unusual finger movements near his/her face?
questions.explanation: Repetitive or stereotyped movements

questions.text: Does your child ever try to attract your attention to his/her own activity?
questions.explanation: Joint attention and social referencing

sections.name: Social Interaction and Communication
sections.description: Questions about social interaction and communication preferences (based on AQ-10)

questions.text: I often notice small sounds when others do not
questions.explanation: Auditory hypersensitivity and attention to detail

questions.text: I usually concentrate more on the whole picture, rather than the small details
questions.explanation: Cognitive style and attention patterns

questions.text: I find it easy to do more than one thing at once
questions.explanation: Executive functioning and multitasking abilities

questions.text: I enjoy social chit-chat
questions.explanation: Social communication preferences

questions.text: I find it easy to 'read between the lines' when someone is talking to me
questions.explanation: Understanding implied meaning and social context

questions.text: I know how to tell if someone listening to me is getting bored
questions.explanation: Social awareness and perspective-taking

questions.text: When I'm reading a story I find it difficult to work out the characters' intentions
questions.explanation: Theory of mind and understanding others' mental states

questions.text: I like to collect information about categories of things
questions.explanation: Special interests and systematic information gathering

questions.text: I find it easy to work out what someone is thinking or feeling just by looking at their face
questions.explanation: Facial emotion recognition and social cognition

questions.text: I find it difficult to work out people's intentions
questions.explanation: Understanding others' motivations and social intentions

critical_items.description: Items most predictive of ASD characteristics
critical_items.message: Three or more critical items indicating concerns warrant professional evaluation

social_communication.moderate: Some challenges in social communication noted

overall_interpretation.low_risk: Results suggest typical development patterns. Continue monitoring development.
overall_interpretation.moderate_risk: Some areas of concern identified. Consider discussing with healthcare provider.
overall_interpretation.elevated_risk: Multiple areas of concern identified. Professional evaluation recommended.

source_instruments: M-CHAT-R (Modified Checklist for Autism in Toddlers, Revised)
validation.sensitivity: High for identifying individuals who may benefit from further evaluation
validation.specificity: Moderate - false positives possible, professional evaluation needed
references: Robins, D. L., et al. (2014). Validation of the M-CHAT-R
Allison, C., et al. (2012). The AQ-10: A short screening instrument

disclaimer.purpose: Screening and educational tool only - not for diagnosis
limitations: May produce false positives or negatives
Cultural and linguistic factors may affect responses
recommendations: Use as part of comprehensive assessment approach
